arm_group.description: Brain Fitness Training, Posit Science SF

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to reveal the specific effects of computer-aided cognitive
      training on course and rehabilitation in early onset schizophrenia

clinical_study.brief_title: Neuroplasticity-oriented Cognitive Intervention in Early Onset and First Admission Schizophrenia

detailed_description.textblock:
Impairment in cognitive functions is one of the main symptoms in schizophrenia and is
      currently one of the challenges in the treatment of the disease. We examine the beneficial
      effect of computer-aided training program on course and rehabilitation of young psychotic
      patients with early onset psychosis. In addition we develop predictors for the course of
      disorder from neuroimaging data.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Early Onset Psychosis

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Chronicity

          -  Insufficient German skills

intervention.description: Computer aided cognitive training based on principles of neuroplasticity
intervention.intervention_name: Brain Fitness Training, Posit Science SF

clinical_study.official_title: Neuroplasticity-oriented Cognitive Intervention in Early Onset and First Admission Schizophrenia

oversight_info.authority: Germany: University of Konstanz Ethics Committee

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline at post-training and at 3-months and at 7-months follow-up in each of the following outcome measures: neuropsychological test performance (MCCCB), GAF, PANSS, MEG event-related potentials (M50), alpha activity
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline,  post-training (training duration 4 weeks), 3-month follow-up, 7-month follow-up

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in GAF score at 3-months and 7-moths follow-up
